Package com.hissain.jscipy.signal

Class Signal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hissain.jscipy.signal.Signal
  • public class Signal
extends java.lang.Object
    A facade class providing static utility methods for signal processing, similar to scipy.signal. This class delegates to specific implementations within the library.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Signal()

      • filtfilt

        public static double[] filtfilt​(double[] signal,
                                double sampleRate,
                                double cutoff,
                                int order)
        Applies a zero-phase Butterworth low-pass filter (forward and backward).
        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
        cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
        order - The filter order.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • cheby1_filtfilt

        public static double[] cheby1_filtfilt​(double[] signal,
                                       double sampleRate,
                                       double cutoff,
                                       int order,
                                       double rippleDb)
        Applies a zero-phase Chebyshev Type I low-pass filter (forward and backward).
        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
        cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
        order - The filter order.
        rippleDb - The passband ripple in decibels.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

        Parameters:

        sampleRate - The sample rate of the signal.
        cutoff - The cutoff frequency.
        order - The filter order.
        stopBandDb - The stopband attenuation in decibels.
        Returns:
        The filtered signal.

      • detrend

        public static double[] detrend​(double[] signal,
                               DetrendType type)
        Removes a linear or constant trend from the signal.
        Parameters:
        signal - The input signal.
        type - The type of detrending (LINEAR or CONSTANT).
        Returns:
        The detrended signal.

      • find_peaks

        public static int[] find_peaks​(double[] x,
                               java.lang.Double height,
                               java.lang.Integer distance,
                               java.lang.Double prominence)
        Finds peaks in a signal with optional parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        height - Minimum height of peaks (optional, null to ignore).
        distance - Minimum distance between peaks (optional, null to ignore).
        prominence - Minimum prominence of peaks (optional, null to ignore).
        Returns:
        The indices of found peaks.

      • find_peaks

        public static int[] find_peaks​(double[] x)
        Finds peaks in a signal with default parameters.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        Returns:
        The indices of found peaks.

      • hanning

        public static double[] hanning​(int m)
        Returns a Hanning window of length M.
        Parameters:
        m - The length of the window.
        Returns:
        The Hanning window.

      • hanning

        public static double[] hanning​(int m,
                               boolean symmetric)
        Returns a Hanning window of length M.
        Parameters:
        m - The length of the window.
        symmetric - If true, generates a symmetric window (for filter design). If false, generates a periodic window (for spectral analysis).
        Returns:
        The Hanning window.

      • hamming

        public static double[] hamming​(int m)
        Returns a Hamming window of length M.
        Parameters:
        m - The length of the window.
        Returns:
        The Hamming window.

      • hamming

        public static double[] hamming​(int m,
                               boolean symmetric)
        Returns a Hamming window of length M.
        Parameters:
        m - The length of the window.
        symmetric - If true, generates a symmetric window (for filter design). If false, generates a periodic window (for spectral analysis).
        Returns:
        The Hamming window.

      • fft

        public static JComplex[] fft​(double[] x)
        Computes the forward FFT of a real-valued signal.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        Returns:
        The complex-valued FFT of the signal.

      • ifft

        public static JComplex[] ifft​(JComplex[] x)
        Computes the inverse FFT of a complex-valued signal.
        Parameters:
        x - The complex-valued input signal.
        Returns:
        The complex-valued inverse FFT of the signal.

      • rfft

        public static JComplex[] rfft​(double[] x)
        Computes the forward FFT of a real-valued signal and returns the positive frequency components (RFFT).
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        Returns:
        The positive frequency components of the FFT.

      • irfft

        public static double[] irfft​(JComplex[] x,
                             int n)
        Computes the inverse FFT of a real-valued signal (IRFFT).
        Parameters:
        x - The complex-valued input signal (positive frequencies).
        n - The length of the original signal.
        Returns:
        The real-valued inverse FFT of the signal.

      • convolve

        public static double[] convolve​(double[] signal,
                                double[] window,
                                ConvolutionMode mode)
        Convolves two signals using the specified mode.
        Parameters:
        signal - The first signal.
        window - The second signal (window).
        mode - The convolution mode (e.g., ConvolutionMode.SAME).
        Returns:
        The convolved signal.

      • convolve2d

        public static double[][] convolve2d​(double[][] in1,
                                    double[][] in2,
                                    ConvolutionMode mode)
        Convolves two 2D signals using the specified mode.
        Parameters:
        in1 - The first input array.
        in2 - The second input array.
        mode - The convolution mode (FULL, VALID, SAME).
        Returns:
        The convolved 2D array.

      • resample

        public static double[] resample​(double[] x,
                                int num)
        Resamples x to num samples using Fourier method along the given axis.
        Parameters:
        x - The input signal.
        num - The number of samples in the resampled signal.
        Returns:
        The resampled signal.

      • interp1d_linear

        public static double[] interp1d_linear​(double[] x,
                                       double[] y,
                                       double[] newX)
        Performs linear interpolation on the given data points.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
        y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
        newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
        Returns:
        The interpolated values.

      • interp1d_cubic

        public static double[] interp1d_cubic​(double[] x,
                                      double[] y,
                                      double[] newX)
        Performs cubic spline interpolation on the given data points.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinates of the data points.
        y - The y-coordinates of the data points.
        newX - The x-coordinates at which to evaluate the interpolated values.
        Returns:
        The interpolated values.
